title: Pixel 4a vibrates when media is playing. Normal?
content:
So whenever I'm playing any media(audio/video) on the phone, the entire back panel vibrates due to the sound waves. And the vibration gets intense as I increase the volume. It really is annoying and doesn't contribute to a good experience
After noticing this myself, I went online and read other reviews to check whether only my unit was faulty, and it turns out to be a design flaw/issue with the Pixel 4a. A lot of people are reporting this.

Notably, Pixel 3 had similar issues, but Google's response to that was around the IP water and dust resistant coating/seal. Pixel 4a does not even have an IPXX rating.
Expecting Google to do something about this.
